intro: Wendlandiella gracilis var. simplicifrons, commonly known as the slenderleaf wendlandiella, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
